data.event: The 2010 United States census reported Madison's population was 503.
The Cache Creek post office opened in 1852, moved and changed its name to Madison in 1877.

event.title: moved and changed its name to Madison in 1877

data.event: The Cache Creek post office opened in 1852, moved and changed its name to Madison in 1877.
The townsite was laid out and named "Madison" in 1877 when the railroad, the Vaca Valley and Clear Lake Railroad, reached that spot, as the terminus, after expanding north from Winters.
The 2010 United States Census reported that Madison had a population of 503.
